entry.title: Olive MacLeod (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olive MacLeod (pictured) journeyed 6,000 km (3,700 mi) through Africa in 1910–1911 to visit her murdered fiancé's grave, and wrote a book based on her observations?

entry.title: Church Clothes 4 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Church Clothes 4 deals with Christian hip hop artist Lecrae's faith deconstruction and reconstruction?

entry.title: Richard Newland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Richard Newland is cricket's earliest-known left-handed batter?

entry.title: 2022 University of California academic workers' strike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that construction workers at UC Berkeley paused their work in solidarity with the 2022 University of California academic workers' strike?

entry.title: Taingda Mingyi U Pho (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Taingda Mingyi U Pho engineered the massacre of around 40 members of the Burmese royal family in order to eliminate nearly all possible heirs to the throne?

entry.title: Tennessee State Route 396 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tennessee State Route 396 was constructed to provide access to the Spring Hill Manufacturing plant of Saturn Corporation?

entry.title: Maurice Suckling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Arthur Forrest suggested that the squadron of French ships were looking for a battle, Captain Maurice Suckling replied "I think it would be a pity to disappoint them"?

entry.title: a Vermont radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an apparently jobless man wearing a cardboard box who taped himself to a lamppost was actually a new DJ for a Vermont radio station?
